to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task
lit. flower viewing from horseback (idiom); a fleeting glance in passing/fig. superficial understanding from cursory observation/to make a quick judgment based on inadequate information
lantern with carousel of paper horses, rotating under convection, used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节/fig. constant busy circulation of people
lit. flower viewing from horseback (idiom); fig. superficial understanding from cursory observation/to make a quick judgment based on inadequate information

sentences.english: He came to office only six weeks ago, offering hope.
sentences.chinese: 6周以前，他深孚衆望，走馬上任。

sentences.english: The elections were over and the first native Governor was inaugurated.
sentences.chinese: 選舉結束，第一個在當地土生土長的州長走馬上任了。

sentences.english: There is a missing forepaw cursory, there are acute water and waves back.
sentences.chinese: 走馬有個前蹄失，急水也有回頭浪。

sentences.english: The household tax system of collecting articles by the nine grades families was reflected in the Wu Bamboo Slips excavated in Zhoumalou, Changsha.
sentences.chinese: 長沙走馬樓出土的吳簡中有戶調分爲九品收物的內容。

sentences.english: Does your weight affect chances of you landing that next job?
sentences.chinese: 體重會不會影響你能否在一個新的領域裏走馬上任呢？

sentences.english: Why does the lantern turn when we light up the electric bulb?
sentences.chinese: 當我們點亮燈泡時，爲什麼走馬燈會轉動？

sentences.english: Over the past years, the "problem foods" appeared one after another.
sentences.chinese: 這幾年，問題食品像走馬燈似的，你方唱罷我登場。

sentences.english: A day is a tourist; a year is a traveller.
sentences.chinese: 一天只能走馬看花，一年方能稱之旅人。

sentences.english: And my only thing need to do is to go to take up my office.
sentences.chinese: 而我唯一要做的事情就是走馬上任了。

sentences.english: Tunnel discharge disaster is a severe problem of Zoumaling tunnel.
sentences.chinese: 重慶走馬嶺隧道開挖中岩溶湧水災害是一個突出問題。

sentences.english: After lunch, I managed a brief visit to the Longmen Grottoes.
sentences.chinese: 喫過午餐後，我走馬觀花地參觀了龍門石窟。

sentences.english: He just rushed through the book .
sentences.chinese: 他只不過走馬看花地看完了這本書。

sentences.english: The transfer of administrative personnel in that colony was so frequent as to create a kaleidoscopic effect.
sentences.chinese: 在那個殖民地，行政官員調換頻繁，就像走馬燈似的。

sentences.english: Mr. President, I’m eager to assume this new position.
sentences.chinese: 總統先生，我熱切地盼望走馬上任。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, due to the time reason, we can only be a cursory looking at flowers.
sentences.chinese: 遺憾的是，由於時間的限制，我們也只能是走馬看花。

sentences.english: Although our tour today was brief.
